questions.question_text: Which of the following is a characteristic of a single mirrored data center used for disaster recovery?

choices.B: The mirrored site may create brief interruptions noticeable to users.
choices.A: Data replication to the mirrored site should continue after failover.
choices.D: The mirrored data center does not require staffing.
choices.C: Real-time data replication occurs from the production site.

discussion.content: C. Real-time data replication occurs from the production site.

Selected Answer: D
Baselining the IT control environment involves assessing the current state of IT controls and practices within an organization. This process helps identify the baseline level of control effectiveness and detect any deviations or deficiencies from expected norms. By establishing this baseline, organizations can better understand their current control environment, identify areas for improvement, and track progress over time.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the PRIMARY objective of baselining the IT control environment?

choices.D: To obtain agreement with management on action plan status
choices.A: To align IS audit activities with business objectives
choices.B: To help management prioritize related risk mitigation activities
choices.C: To determine the effectiveness of management's responses to risk

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the PRIMARY purpose of conducting an IS audit follow-up?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"to validate remediation efforts." The primary purpose of conducting follow-up audits for material observations is to determine whether the remediation efforts implemented by management have been successful in addressing the identified deficiencies or areas of improvement.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST effective control for protecting the confidentiality and integrity of data stored unencrypted on virtual machines?

discussion.content: I think answer is B as it's talking about the most

Selected Answer: B
While limiting the creation of virtual machine images and snapshots (option D) may also help mitigate risks associated with data stored on virtual machines, it may not be as effective as restricting access to existing images and snapshots, particularly if unauthorized individuals already have access to these resources.

Therefore, restricting access to images and snapshots of virtual machines is likely the MOST effective control for protecting the confidentiality and integrity of data stored unencrypted on virtual machines.

Selected Answer: B
